main event: A green fireball UFO was observed in Southeasterm New Mexico on April 21, 1951. It approached to within a few miles, discarded red and green particles, and burned itself out over a 10-minute period at about 10:00 P.M.
interesting points: Several persons witnessed the green fireball, adding credibility to the sighting.
The object approached to within a few miles before burning itself out, indicating a close proximity to the observers.
It discarded red and green particles, suggesting some form of controlled or deliberate actions by the object.
The apparent speed of the green fireball was reported to be low, contrary to common UFO characteristics.
The sighting lasted for 10 minutes, allowing for a detailed observation of the object.
